snippet: Also, the financial windfall of "Charlie Bit My Finger," the dust-up between Felix Salmon and Michael Kinsley and Bloomberg Businessweek goes inside the Murdoch hacking war room.
abstract: Also, the financial windfall of "Charlie Bit My Finger," the dust-up between Felix Salmon and Michael Kinsley and Bloomberg Businessweek goes inside the Murdoch hacking war room.
lead_paragraph: Google is developing a home entertainment device that will wirelessly connect with other home equipment, bringing the company "more broadly into consumer electronics," David Streitfeld and Nicole Perlroth report. It exists in prototype and will be tested in employees' homes this summer; the initial purpose of the device will be for streaming music, but its eventual use could be much wider. The news, which was first reported by the tech-news site GigaOM, had been kept secret and emerged from a filing with the Federal Communications Commission.

headline.main: The Breakfast Meeting: Google to Make Stuff, and Pelosi's 'Attack' on Colbert
